page.title: 14SAND QUARRIES 2 L. BUZZARD
page.content: Joseph Arnold excavate six sand quarries and the extracted sands are sent to a main processing plant which is at a quarry outside this area. At present they employ 40 excluding management, some of which carry out maintenance work to machinery. The company believes it can remain quarrying at least some types of sand for at least a further 50 years. Areas to be worked are stripped of topsoil and clay overburden by excavators and dumptrucks or scrapers. These materials are stored in heaps for restoring the land at a later date or taken to another area when restoration is needed. Sand can be dug by excavators or loading shovels. There are very few stones in Leighton Buzzard sand. The largest stones are found are normally no bigger than 6mm and these are sold as fine shingle.
